item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: Early Game Switch Axe Build
item.description:
In Monster Hunter Wilds , the Switch Axe is a close-range weapon that can swap between two forms, but its two-sided nature may put some players off. In the early game, Switch Axes take a long time to figure out, especially if you are new to Monster Hunter with Monster Hunter Wilds . But don't let the morphing mechanic turn you off.

In the early game, if you can learn the Switch Axe playstyle, Monster Hunter Wilds Switch Axe builds can absolutely shred through monsters without ever leaving melee range. To make the best Switch Axe build for early Monster Hunter Wilds and Low Rank, craft one of the best early Switch Axes, equip useful armor sets, and try to pick up Equipment Skills that enhance your Switch Axe damage and evasion.

Best Early Switch Axes For Low HR/Campaign

Depending on where you are in the main campaign for Monster Hunter Wilds , the best early Switch Axes will differ. Though the Dosha Fleshhacker is our recommendation for the best early Switch Axe in Monster Hunter Wilds , you won't be able to unlock it until mid-way through the campaign, until you defeat the Alpha Doshaguma.

The high Affinity makes it easier to get critical hits with this weapon.

Don't get used to crits for too long, though. The best Low Rank Switch Axe actually has -5% affinity, which reduces the chance for crits. Thankfully, it's made up for with the highest raw damage for an early Switch Axe.

Though it has -5% negative Affinity, the Dosha Fleshhacker is the best early Switch Axe in Monster Hunter Wilds for its high raw damage output and its Power Prolonger skill. This skill increases the amount of time you can stay in Sword Form and keeps the Switch Gauge and Amp Gauge full for longer.

The Dosha Fleshhacker, and its upgraded versions, are so strong that you won't need to replace them until you hit the late campaign and unlock High Rank Monster Hunter Wilds content.

To unlock both the Barina Hache and the Dosha Fleshhacker, you must first craft a Bone Axe, a shared prerequisite for both of these Switch Axes.

Best Low HR Switch Axe Armor Sets

Doshaguma Set

The Doshaguma armor set is one of the best armor sets for Switch Axe builds in the early game of Monster Hunter Wilds because of its set bonus. When the whole set is equipped, you will gain one level in the Item Prolonger and Recovery Speed skills and three levels in the Free Meal skill. But these pale in comparison to the set bonus. With two pieces of this set equipped , you will gain the Doshaguma's Might skill.

This is particularly useful for Switch Axe builds because it increases damage output after a successful Offset Attack or Power Clash. Because the Axe Form has an Offset Attack readily available at all times, Switch Axe users can trigger the Doshaguma's Might buff reliably.

Hirabami Set

Each piece of the Hirabami armor set grants one of the most powerful Switch Axe skills in the game. Evade Window can be increased to Level 5 with the full set equipped , which significantly increases the amount of invulnerability time you receive during an Evade.

Like in the Souls games, dodging in Monster Hunter Wilds grants a few frames of total invincibility. Normally, the Monster Hunter Wilds evade isn't as forgiving as the Souls dodge roll, but with Level 5 Evade Window, you'll be able to effectively dodge through enemy attacks instead of away from them, completely changing the close-range melee experience.

Balahara Set

The Balhara set offers some of the most useful Equipment Skills in Monster Hunter Wilds , but unlike the Doshaguma set, it doesn't offer a Switch Axe-specific Set Bonus. Instead, equipping all pieces to this set will grant the Hunger Resistance and Quick Sheathe skills at level 1, but more importantly, it grants Level 3 Evade Extender .

Arguably the best basic Equipment Skill in Monster Hunter Wilds for melee weapon builds, Evade Extender does what it says on the tin – with this skill, your dodge rolls will travel further than normal. Because the full Balahara Set grants the maximum Level 3 Evade Extender, your dodge rolls will go about three times as far as normal with this set equipped.

Lala Barina Set

The Lala Barina is a spine-tingling spider boss that rewards one of the best very early armor sets for Switch Axe builds. When equipped, pieces to the Lala Barina set will boost Recovery Up to Level 3 and grant Level 2 Paralysis Resistance. Though the set doesn't have any inherent Set Bonus, Recovery Up is a very powerful regeneration skill in Monster Hunter Wilds , and the defenses aren't bad for the early section of the game you unlock it in.

The Lala Barina set isn't necessarily a bad armor set for Switch Axe builds, it's just not quite as synergistic with the Switch Axe strengths as the Hirabami, Balhara or Doshaguma sets.

Best Early Switch Axe Skills & Talismans

Best Low Rank Switch Axe Equipment Skills

There are three skills you should prioritize when looking for the best Switch Axe skills: Evade Extender, Evade Window, and Adrenaline Rush. Some of these are granted by armor sets recommended above, but Adrenaline Rush is exclusive to the Counterattack Charm and certain Rathalos and Xu Wu equipment.

  • Evade Extender : Increases Evasion distance when dodging
  • Evade Window : Increases invulnerability window when dodging
  • Adrenaline Rush : Temporarily empowers attacks after narrowly dodging an enemy attack

As you progress through the Low Rank campaign, either equip the Hirabami or Balahara sets to gain these skills early, and keep an eye out for these skills on gear you unlock later in the campaign.

Best Early Switch Axe Talismans

Armor and weapons aren't the only equippable items in Monster Hunter Wilds – to put together the best Switch Axe build, Monster Hunter Wilds players must also consider their Talisman. After progressing through the first chapter of the campaign, you will unlock the ability to create Talismans at the Blacksmith (Gemma), who can also craft and upgrade Armors and Weapons.

Talismans are like this game's version of a Ring equippable, granting bonus skills to their wearer, but no extra defensive stats. These four best Switch Axe talismans are the ones you should prioritize obtaining in the early game:

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: Switch Axe Guide
item.description:
One of the most deceptively complex weapons in Monster Hunter games is the Switch Axe, which returns in Monster Hunter Wilds with a newly reworked combat system. With a Switch Axe, Monster Hunter Wilds players can build two separate bars for each of the two forms, which enable powerful elemental bonuses and finishing moves when filled.

The basic Switch Axe playstyle is not too hard to grasp, but there's a lot more going on than just weapon swapping in the middle of a combo. This Monster Hunter Wilds Switch Axe guide goes into the unique mechanics of this morphing weapon, explains how to build and use its three Gauges, details the complete Switch Axe moveset, and suggests the best Switch Axe combos you should know – get the most out of this combo-heavy and mechanical weapon with these Monster Hunter Wilds Switch Axe tips.

Switch Axe Mechanics & Playstyle

How The Switch Axe Works In Monster Hunter Wilds

In Monster Hunter Wilds , the Switch Axe weapon features both an Axe Form and a Sword Form. As you attack in Axe Form, the yellow Switch Gauge meter will build (found below the stamina bar). When the meter passes a small white line threshold, the weapon can morph into Sword Form. The more the Switch Gauge is filled, the longer you can attack in Sword Form, which builds up the red Amp Meter .

  • In Axe Form , the weapon attacks slowly but grants the Hunter remarkably fast movement. Axe Form has easy access to the Offset Rising Slash attack, which can parry incoming monster attacks.
  • Sword Form , on the other hand, reduces movement and reach but grants fast slashing attacks that deal high slashing damage. It also unlocks the weapon's primary finishers.

The key to learning how to use the Switch Axe in Monster Hunter Wilds is understanding how to efficiently swap between these two forms to build the red Amp Meter unleash the full elemental damage of this devastating weapon type.

Spend some time in the Training Area getting used to the flow of the Switch Axe as you swap between weapons to build towards a powerful elemental finisher.

Though it's a relatively simple weapon rotation compared to some of the most complex Monster Hunter Wilds weapons, you must pay careful attention to your Switch Gauge and Amp Gauge meters, and to your positioning with its high-committment combos, to maximize its potential.

Switch Gauge, Power Axe, & Amp Gauge

The Switch Axe weapon type comes with three Gauges to keep track of: the Switch Gauge, Amp Gauge, and Power Axe Gauge .

As you connect hits in Axe Form, you will build up the yellow Switch Gauge meter. As you attack in Sword Form, the Switch Gauge will slowly deplete with each hit. Your Switch Axe will be forced back into Axe Form if the meter goes below the white threshold line. However, as the Switch Gauge depletes, the Amp Meter (bottom-right of the Switch Gauge) will build with each hit that connects in Sword Form.

When this red Amp Gauge is full, all of your Sword attacks will deal extra damage based on the type of Phial your Switch Axe has. You can only use the Full Release Slash and Zero Sum Discharge finishers while this meter is full, but the explosive Element Discharge and Unbridled Slash can be used as long as your Switch Gauge is not depleted.

There is also a Power Axe Gauge on the bottom left of the Switch Gauge. This will fill as you perform certain heavy attacks with the Axe Form of the Switch Axe, like a Heavy Slam after mashing Wild Swing, or the follow-up attack after an Offset Attack. When this meter is orange, your Axe attacks will deal more damage and build the Switch Gauge faster.

What Are Switch Axe Phials?

All Switch Axes have a Phial type that grants extra elemental damage while in a fully Amped state. The Phial also determines the damage type of the elemental finishing moves like Unbridled Slash, Zero Sum Discharge, and of course Element Discharge.

The type of Phial associated with each Switch Axe can be found in the item description. There are six Phials Switch Axes can come with:

  • Power Phial : Explosive damage
  • Element Phial : Elemental damage
  • Poison Phial : Poison status buildup
  • Paralysis Phial : Poison status buildup
  • Dragon Phial : Dragon damage
  • Exhaust Phial : Stun buildup

Complete Switch Axe Moveset In MH Wilds

To swap between Axe Form and Sword Form, press R2 (RT). To enable Sword Form, the Switch Gauge must be filled past the white marker or the mechanic will not work. Press R2 (RT) while standing still to swap Switch Axe form, or press it after an attack to chain into a special Morph attack, which deals damage and swaps to the other form.

You can also press L2 (LT) to enter Focus Mode in either form. This allows you to target specific parts of a monster's body, and if you press R1 (RB) while targeting an exposed wound in either form, you will initiate a special rapid Morph Slash flurry attack that will destroy it.

  • Sword Finisher : Element Discharge > Element Discharge Finisher > Unbridled Slash OR Full Release Slash
    • Press △ + O (Y + B), mash △ (Y) to initiate the finisher explosion, then immediately hold R2 (RT) to trigger an Unbridled Slash follow-up.
    • If your Amp Meter and Power Axe meters are still full, hold R2 + △ + O (RT + Y + B) to perform a follow-up Full Release Slash, which can be charged for maximum damage

item.title: Fortnite Fans Want a Major Change Made to the OG Pass
item.description:
Summary

  • Fortnite fans are unhappy that the OG Pass is priced at 1,000 V-Bucks.
  • Fortnite OG offers nostalgia for veterans and showcases the game's early days for newer players.
  • Subscription to Fortnite Crew includes all passes, V-Bucks, and exclusive skin for $11.99, but some players prefer individual passes.

Fortnite fans have expressed frustration with the current cost of the OG Pass, as it is priced at 1,000 V-Bucks to purchase by itself. In recent years, Fortnite has expanded its offerings, giving players the opportunity to engage with its LEGO Pass, Festival Pass, and OG Pass. Players can claim the benefits of every pass for one price if they subscribe to Fortnite Crew.

Fortnite OG transports players back to 2017, giving Fortnite veterans a bit of nostalgia while offering newer players a chance to see what the game was like when it first launched. The new game mode was a success from the very start, reaching 1.1 million concurrent players within a few hours of its release. The first season of Fortnite OG even had its own section in Fortnite 's Item Shop, giving players the rare opportunity to acquire the Renegade Raider and Aerial Assault Trooper skins.

In a recent post on Reddit, Classic-Spiral suggested that Fortnite 's OG Pass is overpriced, as it currently costs 1,000 V-Bucks to purchase on its own. Many gamers agreed, pointing out that the game's main battle pass is the exact same price but includes at least twice as many cosmetics. One person added that the main battle pass also gives players the opportunity to earn 1,500 V-Bucks as they unlock everything. The OG Pass doesn't include any premium currency, which hasn't been popular with some fans. Classic-Spiral stated that the pass should be half the price, as it includes half as many cosmetics as the base battle pass.

Fortnite Fans Think the OG Pass Is Overpriced

Some people suggested that the pricing of the OG Pass could be part Epic Games' push to have players engage with its Crew subscription, which includes every pass, 1,000 V-Bucks, and an exclusive Fortnite skin every month. While many fans feel that the $11.99 price tag of the Crew subscription is worth it, others don't like the idea that they're being pushed into paying monthly for the popular battle royale. Of course, gamers do have the option of purchasing each pass on their own for a higher price.

Unfortunately, the popularity of Fortnite OG has faded to a degree. Epic Games recently announced that it would be shutting down the servers for Fortnite 's OG Ranked Zero Build mode due to "matchmaking health," which means not enough players were engaging with it. While some gamers were shocked by the news, others suggested that Fortnite OG was a flash in the pan that gave people what they wanted for a few weeks and then lost a lot of its players. Despite some issues with the pricing of some passes and a few hiccups with Fortnite OG, many fans are optimistic about the future of Fortnite .

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: How to Increase HR (Hunter Rank)
item.description:
In Monster Hunter games, Hunter Rank is a system generally tied to players' progression through the game, and in Monster Hunter Wilds it's no different. Hunter Rank generally represents how far a player is in the game, especially in Low Rank. But in High Rank, Hunter Rank works a bit differently – and has a higher Hunter Rank cap.

For players new to Monster Hunter , the Hunter Rank system in Monster Hunter Wilds may seem confusing. Essentially, by increasing your Hunter Rank, Monster Hunter Wilds will reward you with new content, new equipment, and new bosses to take on as your character levels up.

What Is Hunter Rank?

Hunter Rank Represents Your Character Level

In Monster Hunter Wilds , Hunter Rank is both a representation of your character's prowess, and a stat that unlocks new content as you raise it . To see your current Hunter Level, open up your 'Hunter Profile' on the 'Info' tab of the menu . Then tab to the right to see your Equipment and Status screen . Your current HR level will be listed below your character's name at the top of the Status display.

As you raise your Hunter Rank, Monster Hunter Wilds players will unlock higher-level monsters to fight, stronger gear to equip, and new optional and side content to take on.

What's The Max Hunter Rank In Monster Hunter Wilds?

The max Hunter Rank in Monster Hunter Wilds caps out at HR level 999 . This allows for practically infinite progression in the endgame, but during the main campaign missions, the Monster Hunter Wilds max Hunter Rank is capped at Level 15 , the max Hunter Rank for the Low Rank portion of the game before rolling credits.

After finishing the game, this cap will unlock as players unlock endgame and High Rank Monster Hunter Wilds content.

What's The Difference Between Low HR vs High HR?

The simplest way to think about Low HR vs High HR is to consider Low Hunter Rank as the main campaign and story portion of the game, while High Hunter Rank is the endgame .

While in Low Rank, you will only be able to acquire LR equipment and fight LR monsters, mostly as part of progression through main missions. But in High Rank the entire rest of the game opens up, including scaling monster difficulties, powerful High Rank-exclusive gear, and other side content exclusive to the Monster Hunter Wilds post-story.

How To Increase Hunter Rank In Monster Hunter Wilds

To increase Hunter Rank, Monster Hunter Wilds players must complete main missions, side missions, or successfully finish hunts . Defeating monsters and completing quests both reward HR.

To raise your Hunter Rank quickly, take on special Assignments and Optional Missions as you complete the main story in Low Rank. The maximum Hunter Rank in Low Rank Monster Hunter Wilds is 15, which you should be able to reach well before credits roll if you complete all side content along the way.

In High Rank, you can start gaining Hunter Rank Points (HRP) by completing specific types of content . The best way to raise Hunter Rank Monster Hunter Wilds players can employ is to take on Side Quests . There are dozens of side quests that unlock after credits roll, so go back through every region and check them off one-by-one to quickly increase your Hunter Rank and get more HRP. You can also complete regular quests (and Hunts) to gain HRP.

Remember to take on optional missions and defeat bosses in the open world between side missions to increase your Hunter Level more effectively in both High and Low Rank.

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket's Triumphant Light is One Small Set for Collectors, One Giant Leap For The Meta
item.description:
Summary

  • Triumphant Light set reshaped the meta with strong Arceus Ex, dealing up to 130 damage with 3 Energy.
  • Celebi Ex & Leafeon Ex deck now counter Charizard Ex/Moltres Ex thanks to Leafeon Ex's Forest Breath ability making Celebi hit harder faster.
  • Articuno Ex deck got stronger with Irida, a new Supporter card healing all Water Pokemon with Water Energy.

Despite the recent release of the big Gen 4-themed set called Space-Time Smackdown, Pokemon TCG Pocket released another small-scale set just a few days ago, immediately after Pokemon Day 2025. There were many leaks leading up to the launch of Pokemon TCG Pocket 's Triumphant Light set, and several of them mentioned that the main critter for the expansion would be Arceus, following the Origin Temple theme of set A2 featuring Dialga and Palkia. Some fans lamented the release cadence of sets in 2025 due to Space-Time Smackdown coming on January 30 and Triumphant Light just 28 days after, but the A2a expansion is reasonably small - just not in terms of impact on the meta.

Not all Pokemon TCG Pocket players like to engage with the battling aspect of the game, and the title's main appeal could simply be its free booster pack-opening feature and collecting cards. For those fans, Triumphant Light may be a bit too soon out of the oven, but it only contains 75 cards, and is much more similar in size to Mythical Island than any other set. However, for the fans who do like battles in any shape or form, this small set completely reshaped the meta that Space-Time Smackdown established.

How Pokemon TCG Pocket's Triumphant Light Set Changed The Meta

Three main deck archetypes for Pokemon TCG Pocket have benefitted a lot from Triumphant Light so far, though the meta is still evolving, and things may change further. These decks include:

  • Energy acceleration Dialga Ex
  • Energy acceleration Celebi Ex
  • 18-Trainer card Articuno Ex

Pokemon TCG Pocket's Dialga Ex and Arceus Ex Deck Explained

Dialga Ex was not in the top spot when Space-Time Smackdown came out nor did it climb up the ranks all that much in the following weeks. It's a solid deck thanks to Dialga Ex's Metal Turbo attack, which grants 2 Metal Energy to any benched Pokemon, making it great for combos with Pokemon TCG Pocket 's Mew Ex or Yanmega Ex - if not another Dialga Ex. With Triumphant Light, however, the deck can now count on Arceus Ex to deal up to 130 damage to opposing Pokemon with just 3 Energy, making it incredibly strong and reliable against opposing Ex cards. Furthermore, some decklists run Mew Ex to counter big hitters as well as the new Sky Support Shaymin to replace Leaf in the deck for easier retreat.

Pokemon TCG Pocket's Celebi Ex and Leafeon Ex Deck Explained

Pokemon TCG Pocket 's Exeggutor Ex and Celebi Ex deck has been very popular so far even into Space-Time Smackdown, but Exeggutor Ex is probably going to see significantly less play moving forward thanks to Leafeon Ex from Triumphal Light. This is because Leafeon Ex has a more reliable attack in Solar Beam for 70 damage, but more importantly, it has the Forest Breath ability, which provides any Grass Pokemon with 1 Grass Energy if Leafeon Ex is in the active spot. This can accelerate Celebi Ex with ease and even counter decks like Charizard Ex/Moltres Ex, which would normally win this matchup.

Pokemon TCG Pocket's 18-Trainer Articuno Ex Deck Explained

Not a lot has changed for Articuno Ex decks in terms of Pokemon used, as the theme remains to run 18 Trainer cards and two copies of Articuno Ex, but the deck has gotten stronger still in Triumphant Light. This is because of the new Triumphant Light card Irida, which is a Supporter card that heals all Pokemon that have Water Energy attached to them. This is an amazing card that gives Water decks some of the healing power Grass has with Erika, and in an 18-Trainer card deck it's enough to push its usage rate up high by quite a lot. This may be the least powerful or consistent deck of the bunch, but players can still pull a surprise victory with Misty or otherwise keep Articuno Ex alive more easily with Irida.
